result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis L Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. If not paid in full on or before 3/23/17, stay on jail time will be lifted.

Stayed. If Defendant pays fine and costs in full on or before 3/23/17, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 3/23/17, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Curtis L Peterson in court with attorney James Creviere Foote. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 2. Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
No violent contact with SK. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Curtis L Peterson in court. Attorney James Creviere Foote appeared by phone. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises he was just hired Wednesday, has received copy of Complaint. Court reviews charges. Defense enters not guilty pleas. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for January 23, 2017 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Curtis L Peterson appeared by phone. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant will get an attorney if it can't be worked out today, got some mailings, will start contacting attorneys who contacted him, will need 2 weeks. State has no objection, is not comfortable setting bond without Defendant here in person. Defendant is to appear in person on 11/21.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from Defendant requesting phone appearance for 11/7/14. Per Court, approved.
